cards.name: Sylvan Safekeeper
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"He has been to the heart of the wood. Did you truly expect to wield power over him?"
—Oakhide druid
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Target creature you control gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Terastodon
cards.text: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

rulings.text: The targeted permanents may be controlled by different players.

If a targeted permanent has indestructible or regenerates, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it. Similarly, if the targeted permanent is destroyed but a replacement effect moves it to a different zone instead of its owner's graveyard, its controller won't get an Elephant token for it.

cards.originalText: When Terastodon enters the battlefield, you may destroy up to three target noncreature permanents. For each permanent put into a graveyard this way, its controller creates a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.

cards.name: Thornweald Archer
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Their arrows are tipped with basilisk eyes and fletched with cockatrice feathers.
cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Thunderfoot Baloth
cards.text:
Trample
Lieutenant — As long as you control your commander, Thunderfoot Baloth gets +2/+2 and other creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.
cards.flavor: If you hear it, it's too late.

rulings.text: Lieutenant abilities apply only if your commander is on the battlefield and under your control.
Lieutenant abilities refer only to whether you control your commander, not any other player's commander.

If you gain control of a creature with a lieutenant ability owned by another player, that ability will check to see if you control your commander and will apply if you do. It won't check whether its owner controls their commander.

If you lose control of your commander, lieutenant abilities of creatures you control will immediately stop applying. If this causes a creature's toughness to become less than or equal to the amount of damage marked on it, the creature will be destroyed.

If a triggered ability granted by a lieutenant ability triggers, and in response to that trigger you lose control of your commander (causing the lieutenant to lose that ability), that triggered ability will still resolve.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Lieutenant — As long as you control your commander, Thunderfoot Baloth gets +2/+2 and other creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.

cards.name: Timberwatch Elf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Even through the Mirari's voice, the elves still hear the call of their kinship.

rulings.text: The number of Elves on the battlefield is counted only as Timberwatch Elf's ability resolves. If Timberwatch Elf is still on the battlefield, it'll count itself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves on the battlefield.

cards.name: Titania, Protector of Argoth
cards.text:
When Titania, Protector of Argoth enters the battlefield, return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a land you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 5/3 green Elemental creature token.
cards.originalText:
When Titania, Protector of Argoth enters the battlefield, return target land card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a land you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, create a 5/3 green Elemental creature token.

cards.name: Titania's Chosen
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.
cards.flavor:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle
cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.

cards.name: Tornado Elemental
cards.text:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Tribute to the Wild
cards.text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"You may enter, but leave those lifeless things of your world behind."
—Modruni, maro-sorcerer
cards.originalText: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Viridian Emissary
cards.text: When Viridian Emissary dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: When Viridian Emissary dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Viridian Zealot
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Zealot: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: "I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Zealot: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Wall of Blossoms
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Wave of Vitriol
cards.text: Each player sacrifices all artifacts, enchantments, and nonbasic lands they control. For each land sacrificed this way, its controller may search their library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices all artifacts, enchantments, and nonbasic lands he or she controls. For each land sacrificed this way, its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.name: Wellwisher
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Close your ears to the voice of greed, and you can turn a gift for one into a gift for many."
cards.originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life for each Elf on the battlefield.

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures with flying.

cards.name: Wolfbriar Elemental
cards.text:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each time it was kicked.
cards.originalText:
Multikicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
When Wolfbriar Elemental enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each time it was kicked.

cards.name: Wolfcaller's Howl
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens, where X is the number of your opponents with four or more cards in hand.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge is a stain that only instinct and ferocity can cleanse."
—Drarg, wolfcaller

rulings.text: Use the number of opponents who have four or more cards in hand as the ability resolves to determine the value of X.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, create X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens, where X is the number of your opponents with four or more cards in hand.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Wren's Run Packmaster
cards.text:
Champion an Elf (When this creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this creature leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Wolves you control have deathtouch.

rulings.text: Wren's Run Packmaster gives deathtouch to all Wolf permanents you control, not just the tokens it creates.

A Wolf's deathtouch ability will apply if both Wren's Run Packmaster and that Wolf are on the battlefield at the time the Wolf deals damage. The creature dealt damage by the Wolf will be destroyed the next time state-based actions are checked, even if the Wolf or Wren's Run Packmaster leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Champion an Elf (When this creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this creature leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
Wolves you control have deathtouch.

cards.name: Aethermage's Touch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. It gains "At the beginning of your end step, return this creature to its owner's hand." Then put the rest of the cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If you don't reveal any creature cards, or if you choose not to put a revealed creature card onto the battlefield, all the revealed cards go on the bottom of your library.
If the creature that you put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield before your next end step, it won't be returned to your hand at the beginning of your next end step.
If you put a creature onto the battlefield this way during your end step, it won't be returned to your hand until your next end step.
The triggered ability that the creature gains won't be copied if an effect creates a token that's a copy of that creature or causes another object to become a copy of that creature.

cards.originalText: Reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. It gains "At the beginning of your end step, return this creature to its owner's hand." Then put the rest of the cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Angel of Despair
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
cards.flavor:
"I feel in them a sense of duty and commitment, yet I can feel nothing else. It is as if their duty is to an empty void."
—Razia, Boros archangel
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Despair enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Basandra, Battle Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor: "Why listen to the mumblings of wizards when the lash speaks true?"

rulings.text: While Basandra, Battle Seraph is on the battlefield, players can't cast any spells during the combat phase, including permanent spells with flash.
Players may still activate abilities during combat.

If, during a player's declare attackers step, a creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Players can't cast spells during combat.
{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

cards.name: Bladewing the Risen
cards.text:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen enters the battlefield, you may return target Dragon permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{B}{R}: Dragon creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen enters the battlefield, you may return target Dragon permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{B}{R}: Dragon creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Derevi, Empyrial Tactician
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Derevi, Empyrial Tactician enters the battlefield or a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may tap or untap target permanent.
{1}{G}{W}{U}: Put Derevi onto the battlefield from the command zone.

rulings.text: You can activate Derevi's last ability only when it is in the command zone.

When you activate Derevi's last ability, you're not casting Derevi as a spell. The ability can't be countered by something that counters only spells. The ability isn't subject to the additional cost of casting commanders from the command zone.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Derevi, Empyrial Tactician enters the battlefield or a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may tap or untap target permanent.
{1}{G}{W}{U}: Put Derevi onto the battlefield from the command zone.

cards.name: Golgari Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"Let the rest of Ravnica sneer. One way or another, they all end up in the undercity."
—Jarad
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Regenerate each creature you control.

cards.name: Grisly Salvage
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: To the Golgari, anything buried is treasure.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord
cards.text:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Jarad's first ability applies only when Jarad is on the battlefield.
The life loss is based on the power of the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

To activate Jarad's last ability, you must sacrifice two lands. It doesn't matter what other land types the two lands have, as long as one is a Swamp and one is a Forest. Even if one of the lands you sacrifice is both a Swamp and a Forest, you have to sacrifice another land that is a Swamp or a Forest.
You can sacrifice any land with the land type Swamp or Forest, not just ones named Swamp or Forest. For example, you could sacrifice two Overgrown Tombs.

cards.originalText:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Kaalia of the Vast
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.
cards.flavor: "I'll have my revenge if I have to call on every force from above and below."

rulings.text: Kaalia's ability doesn't trigger if it attacks a planeswalker.
The creature card is already tapped and attacking as it's put onto the battlefield. Any abilities that trigger when a creature becomes tapped or when a creature attacks won't trigger for that card.

If the opponent Kaalia attacked is no longer in the game when its ability resolves, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card onto the battlefield tapped, but it won't be attacking anyone and it won't be an attacking creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Kaalia of the Vast attacks an opponent, you may put an Angel, Demon, or Dragon creature card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that opponent.

cards.name: Korozda Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Use the sacrificed creature's toughness when it was last on the battlefield to determine the value of X.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Leafdrake Roost
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{G}{U}, {T}: Create a 2/2 green and blue Drake creature token with flying."
cards.flavor:
"The best experiments are those whose successes replicate themselves."
—Yolov, Simic bioengineer
cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{G}{U}, {T}: Create a 2/2 green and blue Drake creature token with flying."

cards.name: Lotleth Troll
cards.text:
Trample
Discard a creature card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Lotleth Troll.
{B}: Regenerate Lotleth Troll.
cards.flavor: He lurks in the undercity, eager for the corpse haulers to unload their rotting cargo.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Discard a creature card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Lotleth Troll.
{B}: Regenerate Lotleth Troll.

cards.name: Malfegor
cards.text:
Flying
When Malfegor enters the battlefield, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.
cards.flavor: A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.

rulings.text: Malfegor's ability is not optional. You must discard your entire hand no matter how many creatures your opponents control.

After you discard your hand and the number of creatures each opponent must sacrifice has been determined, each opponent in turn order, starting with the player whose turn it is if that player is your opponent, chooses which creatures they will sacrifice, then all the chosen creatures are all sacrificed at the same time.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Malfegor enters the battlefield, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Mazirek, Kraul Death Priest
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a player sacrifices another permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
cards.flavor: The clicks and buzz of the undercity proclaim him the incarnation of decay.

rulings.text: If a permanent is sacrificed to pay a cost of a spell or ability, Mazirek's ability will resolve before that spell or ability. Conversely, if a permanent is sacrificed during the resolution of a spell or ability, that spell or ability will finish resolving before Mazirek's ability is put onto the stack.

Mazirek itself doesn't allow any player to sacrifice any permanents. Its ability triggers whenever a player sacrifices a permanent because some other spell, ability, or cost instructed the player to do so.
A legendary creature that dies because of the "legend rule" isn't sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a player sacrifices another permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Meren of Clan Nel Toth
cards.text:
Whenever another creature you control dies, you get an experience counter.
At the beginning of your end step, choose target creature card in your graveyard. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of experience counters you have, return it to the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

rulings.text: If Meren of Clan Nel Toth leaves the battlefield at the same time as other creatures you control die, its first ability will trigger for each of those creatures.
You can't choose to put the creature card into your hand if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of experience counters you have as the ability resolves.
If a creature card in your graveyard has {X} in its mana cost, X is 0.
Experience counters are the second kind of counters a player can have, joining poison.

All experience counters are identical, no matter how you got them. For example, the last ability will count experience counters that you got from the first ability, from another ability, from proliferating, and so on.

Each game pack includes a card labeled "Experience" with the suggestion "Place your experience counters here." This card isn't required for play. It's simply a convenient spot to put your experience counters, which can be represented with dice, glass beads, or other small items.

cards.originalText:
Whenever another creature you control dies, you get an experience counter.
At the beginning of your end step, choose target creature card in your graveyard. If that card's converted mana cost is less than or equal to the number of experience counters you have, return it to the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Mortify
cards.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.
cards.flavor: The eyes let flow with tears, then blood, then the very soul—the whole wrung inside out, dripping down into the blackened puddle of the past.

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an enchantment, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

cards.name: Oros, the Avenger
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Oros, the Avenger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, Oros deals 3 damage to each nonwhite creature.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Oros, the Avenger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, Oros deals 3 damage to each nonwhite creature.

cards.name: Putrefy
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"We are all decaying, always in a state of near-death. One moment without breath and we begin to break down."
—Cevraya, Golgari shaman

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Roon of the Hidden Realm
cards.text:
Vigilance, trample
{2}, {T}: Exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Time and space are just new battlefields to be mastered."

rulings.text: If Roon of the Hidden Realm's ability targets a commander, that card's owner may choose to have it go to the command zone rather than being exiled. The delayed triggered ability will return it to the battlefield no matter which of the two zones it went to, as long as it's still in that zone when that triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Vigilance, trample
{2}, {T}: Exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Rubinia Soulsinger
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.
cards.flavor: "Take up the quill, and feel your future flow into the runes."

rulings.text: If Rubinia Soulsinger leaves the battlefield, you no longer control it, so the duration of its control-change effect ends.

If Rubinia Soulsinger stops being tapped before its ability resolves — even if it becomes tapped again right away — you won't gain control of the targeted creature at all. The same is true if you lose control of Rubinia Soulsinger before the ability resolves.

Once the ability resolves, it doesn't care whether the targeted permanent remains a legal target for the ability, only that it's on the battlefield. The effect will continue to apply to it even if it gains shroud, stops being a creature, or would no longer be a legal target for any other reason.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

cards.name: Selesnya Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Exile target creature with power 5 or greater.
• Create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
• Exile target creature with power 5 or greater.
• Create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.

cards.name: Skyward Eye Prophets
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.
cards.flavor: They lament the doom that is coming to Bant without realizing the part their own leaders have played in it.
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.

cards.name: Tariel, Reckoner of Souls
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: Choose a creature card at random from target opponent's graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"After death you face paradise, damnation, or Tariel."
—Priest's teaching

rulings.text: The only target of this ability is the opponent.

The creature card is chosen at random from among creature cards in the target opponent's graveyard as the ability resolves. Players can respond to the ability knowing the targeted player, but they won't know which creature card is about to enter the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: Choose a creature card at random from target opponent's graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Vulturous Zombie
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.
cards.flavor:
"When something dies, all things benefit. Well okay, just our things."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

rulings.text: The ability doesn't care why a card goes to your opponent's graveyard — only that it does. The ability triggers when a card is put into your opponent's graveyard from the stack (a spell resolves, fails to resolve, or is countered), from the battlefield (a permanent is destroyed or sacrificed), from the player's hand (a card is discarded), from the player's library (from a Millstone-like effect), or from any other zone.
This ability triggers only on cards, so it won't trigger when a token is put into your opponent's graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulturous Zombie.

cards.name: Winged Coatl
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: The nacatl called this new species "vetli," their word for poison arrows.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Wrecking Ball
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land.
cards.flavor: Rakdos festivals almost leave enough rubble in their wake to hide the bodies.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or land.

cards.name: Boros Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

rulings.text: Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger.
Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

cards.originalText:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Gwyllion Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token.
When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger.
Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may create a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token.
When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Master Warcraft
cards.text:
Cast this spell only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

rulings.text: You choose attackers and make blocking assignments regardless of whether it's your turn and regardless of whether the creatures are attacking you. Your choices must be legal within the normal rules for attacking and blocking.
You can decide that a creature won't block.

If the defending player controls a planeswalker, the person who cast Master Warcraft first chooses the complete group of creatures that are going to attack. Then, for each of those creatures, the active player chooses who or what it's going to attack.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText:
Cast Master Warcraft only before attackers are declared.
You choose which creatures attack this turn.
You choose which creatures block this turn and how those creatures block.

cards.name: Mistmeadow Witch
cards.text: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.
cards.originalText: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Murkfiend Liege
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

rulings.text: The abilities are separate and cumulative. If another creature you control is both of the listed colors, it will get a total of +2/+2.
All your green and/or blue creatures untap during each other player's untap step. You have no choice about what untaps. Those creatures untap at the same time as the active player's permanents.

During each other player's untap step, effects that would otherwise cause your green and/or blue creatures to stay tapped don't apply because they only apply during *your* untap step. For example, if you control Nettle Sentinel (a green creature that says "Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step"), you untap it during each other player's untap step.
Multiple Murkfiend Lieges are redundant when it comes to the untap effect. You can't untap your permanents more than once in a single untap step.

cards.originalText:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.name: Orzhov Guildmage
cards.text:
{2}{W}: Target player gains 1 life.
{2}{B}: Each player loses 1 life.
cards.originalText:
{2}{W}: Target player gains 1 life.
{2}{B}: Each player loses 1 life.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Assault Suit

rulings.text: The equipped creature can't be sacrificed for any reason. If an effect instructs you to sacrifice it, you can't and it remains on the battlefield. You also can't sacrifice it to pay a cost that requires you to sacrifice a creature.

If an effect instructs you to sacrifice a creature, and you control any creatures other than the creature equipped with Assault Suit, you must sacrifice one of them. You can't try to sacrifice the equipped creature, fail, and therefore ignore the effect.

cards.name: Azorius Keyrune
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
{W}{U}: Azorius Keyrune becomes a 2/2 white and blue Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The higher the mind soars, the greater its understanding of the law."
—Isperia

rulings.text: Until the ability that turns the Keyrune into a creature resolves, the Keyrune is colorless.

Activating the ability that turns the Keyrune into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to another number, but effects that modify power and/or toughness without directly setting them will still apply.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}: Azorius Keyrune becomes a 2/2 white and blue Bird artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Bonehoard

rulings.text: The value of X is calculated continuously as the number of creature cards in graveyards changes.
If there are no creature cards in any graveyard when Bonehoard's living weapon ability resolves, the Germ will be 0/0 and put into its owner's graveyard.
Although creature tokens go to the graveyard before ceasing to exist, they never count as creature cards and won't increase the bonus granted by Bonehoard, however briefly.

If lethal damage is dealt simultaneously to the equipped creature and another creature, both creatures are put into the graveyard at the same time. The equipped creature won't get an additional bonus from the other creature.

cards.name: Boros Signet
cards.flavor:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Commander's Sphere
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: It harmonizes with the essence of its master.

rulings.text: The color identity of your commander is set before the game begins and doesn't change during the game, even if your commander is in a hidden zone (such as your hand or your library) or if an effect changes your commander's color.
If your commander has no colors in its color identity, Commander's Sphere produces no mana.
In formats other than Commander, Commander's Sphere produces no mana.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.
Sacrifice Commander's Sphere: Draw a card.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.originalText:
Indestructible

cards.name: Eldrazi Monument
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 and have flying and indestructible.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. If you can't, sacrifice Eldrazi Monument.
cards.flavor:
"Gods don't die. They merely slumber."
—Ayli, Kamsa cleric

rulings.text: If you control any creatures as the triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can't choose to sacrifice Eldrazi Monument instead. You sacrifice the Monument only if you had no creatures to sacrifice.

Lethal damage and effects that say "destroy" won't cause a creature with indestructible to be put into the graveyard. However, a creature with indestructible can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed, if it's legendary and another legendary creature with the same name is controlled by the same player, or if its toughness is 0 or less.

cards.originalText:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 and have flying and indestructible.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. If you can't, sacrifice Eldrazi Monument.

cards.name: Emerald Medallion
cards.text: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText: Green spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.

rulings.text: You are not allowed to "unequip" equipment from a creature. cards.name: Seer's Sundial
cards.text: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "The shadow travels toward the apex. I predict we will soon see the true measure of darkness."

rulings.text: The landfall ability triggers whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. It triggers whenever you play a land, as well as whenever a spell or ability (such as Rampant Growth) causes you to put a land onto the battlefield under your control. It will even trigger when a spell or ability causes another player to put a land onto the battlefield under your control (as can happen with Yavimaya Dryad's ability, for example).

When a land enters the battlefield under your control, each landfall ability of the permanents you control will trigger. You can put them on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.
You choose whether to pay {2} as the ability resolves. You may pay {2} only once per resolution.

cards.originalText: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, draw a card.

If no players control at least two more lands than you when the ability resolves, you'll still search and shuffle your library.

cards.name: Faerie Conclave
cards.text:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.

{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Ghost Quarter
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
cards.flavor: Deserted, but not uninhabited.

rulings.text: If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability won't resolve because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.

If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land has indestructible or because it was regenerated.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.
